title: Can an online personal trainer help me to run a new personal best?
text:
It’s late September, the Supreme Court has just ruled that Boris Johnson’s prorogation of Parliament is ‘unlawful, void and of no effect’ (how long ago does that feel now?) and my phone pings with a chipper text from outside the Westminster bubble that I inhabit as The Telegraph's Political Correspondent. “How’s the training going?!”

It's my virtual trainer. My heart sinks. For what feels like the umpteenth time in a matter of weeks, I'm going to have to text back an excuse. Previous lines have included the fact that I'd had my wisdom teeth removed – which received a sympathetic response – and that I'd not gone for a run because I was incredibly hungover – which really didn't. “Dani, we made...
